name: Mezquita-Cathedral
description: A stunning example of Moorish architecture, once the Great Mosque of Córdoba and later converted to a cathedral.

name: Alcázar de los Reyes Cristianos
description: A medieval fortress used by Isabella I of Castile and Ferdinand II of Aragon, featuring beautiful gardens and ancient baths.

name: Roman Bridge
description: An ancient bridge spanning the Guadalquivir River, built in the early 1st century BC, with modern reconstructions.

name: Jewish Quarter (Judería)
description: Historic neighborhood with narrow winding streets and whitewashed houses, once home to Córdoba's Jewish community.

name: Palacio de Viana
description: A noble mansion featuring 12 patios filled with flowers and a rich collection of historic artifacts.

name: Calahorra Tower
description: A fortified gate built in the late 12th century to protect the bridge, now home to a museum about Córdoba's religious history.

name: Medina Azahara
description: The ruins of a vast, fortified palace-city built by Abd-ar-Rahman III, located on the outskirts of Córdoba.

name: Patios Cordobeses
description: Traditional courtyards decorated with flowers, part of Córdoba's annual patio festival.

name: Taberna Salinas
description: One of Córdoba's oldest taverns, serving traditional Andalusian cuisine since 1879.

name: Córdoba Botanical Garden
description: A lush garden featuring a wide variety of plants, including many native to Andalusia.
